Psychology_tweet_144_p.News Finding: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Psychology_tweet_144_p.Paper Finding: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Psychology_tweet_144_p.News Context: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Psychology_tweet_144_p.Paper Context: Individuals reported an increase in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when drinking alcohol (7.0 ± 2.2 versus null hypothesis 5 ¼ "no increase or decrease in pleasure"; t (199) ¼13.0, p < .001). In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09). Perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes did not differ by frequency of binge drinking (F (3,200) ¼ 0.84, p ¼ .47): nonbinge (7.1 ± 2.1), 1-3 binge days (6.8 ± 2.3), 4-8 binge days (7.0 ± 2.1), 9 þ binge days (7.6 ± 2.2).
Psychology_tweet_144_p.text: ['Finding: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).']
Psychology_tweet_144_p.displayed_text: Finding: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).

Psychology_tweet_220_p.News Finding: Dog's gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Psychology_tweet_220_p.Paper Finding: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].
Psychology_tweet_220_p.News Context: Dog's gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Psychology_tweet_220_p.Paper Context: Importantly, however, the accuracy indexes calculated for the cueing phase did not capture gaze following in BC [mean 6 SEM of cumulative accuracy: 20.06 6 0.14; one-sample t test, t(12) = 20.433; p = 0.67; first look: 0.11 6 0.16; one-sample t test, t(12) = 0.695; p = 0.5]. Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045]. These data suggest that the lack of gaze following, when there are no ostensive signals, cannot be accounted for by the confounding effect of ''artificial'' salient attention getter used in the NO condition, also providing further support for the significant role of ostensive signals in dogs' gaze response.
Psychology_tweet_220_p.text: ['Finding: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor\'s gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].']
Psychology_tweet_220_p.displayed_text: Finding: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].

Psychology_tweet_45_p.News Finding: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Psychology_tweet_45_p.Paper Finding: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.
Psychology_tweet_45_p.News Context: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Psychology_tweet_45_p.Paper Context: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication. This review will discuss the current state of our knowledge of immune dysfunction in ASD, how these findings may impact on underlying neuro-immune mechanisms and implicate potential areas where the manipulation of the immune response could have an impact on behavior and immunity in ASD. There is a concordance rate for ASD of 0-37% reported for dizygotic twins, while concordance rates of 44-91% are reported for monozygotic twins (Bailey et al., 1995; Constantino and Todd, 2000; Kates et al., 2004; Steffenburg et al., 1989) , suggesting that genetic composition may contribute to increased risk of developing ASD.
Psychology_tweet_45_p.text: ['Finding: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.']
Psychology_tweet_45_p.displayed_text: Finding: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.

Psychology_510_p.News Finding: Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes.
Psychology_510_p.Paper Finding: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.
Psychology_510_p.News Context: Using this unusually rich source of data, the study was able to look at childhood history compared with adult behavior. Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes. This group reported committing more crimes than folks who had never been convicted, but fewer crimes than people who had been in trouble as juveniles.
Psychology_510_p.Paper Context: Our results, along with past research (see, for example, , indicate that as a whole, apparent adult-onset offenders are responsible for a small minority of total crime. Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood. In fact, on average, official adult-onset men were similar to juvenile-onset men on multiple measures of child and adolescent antisocial behavior.
Psychology_510_p.text: ['Finding: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.']
Psychology_510_p.displayed_text: Finding: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.

Psychology_21_p.News Finding: In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children.
Psychology_21_p.Paper Finding: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).
Psychology_21_p.News Context: Of the 758 young adults recruited for the study, 61 percent were female. In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children. There was a positive relationship between corporal punishment and physical violence during a romantic relationship.
Psychology_21_p.Paper Context: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498). Analysis showed a significant positive association between corporal punishment and physical perpetration of dating violence (OR 1.30, 95% CI 1.07-1.59). Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Psychology_21_p.text: ['Finding: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).']
Psychology_21_p.displayed_text: Finding: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).

Psychology_tweet_82_p.News Finding: 'Suggesting a mechanism whereby doctrinal concepts may come to be intrinsically rewarding and motivate behavior in religious individuals.'
Psychology_tweet_82_p.Paper Finding: Activation of the medial prefrontal cortex in all three tasks may suggest a role in representation of affective meaning for the religious stimuli and suggests that cognitive attribution and judgment of the meaning or value of religious stimuli contributes to their experience.
Psychology_tweet_82_p.News Context: 'Suggesting a mechanism whereby doctrinal concepts may come to be intrinsically rewarding and motivate behavior in religious individuals.'
Psychology_tweet_82_p.Paper Context: The dorsal anterior cingulate cortex in particular may contribute to the perception of salience of religious experience . Activation of the medial prefrontal cortex in all three tasks may suggest a role in representation of affective meaning for the religious stimuli and suggests that cognitive attribution and judgment of the meaning or value of religious stimuli contributes to their experience. A role for the ventromedial prefrontal cortex in shaping belief is also supported by evidence that neuromodulation of this regions can specifically decrease endorsement of religious beliefs .
Psychology_tweet_82_p.text: ['Finding: Activation of the medial prefrontal cortex in all three tasks may suggest a role in representation of affective meaning for the religious stimuli and suggests that cognitive attribution and judgment of the meaning or value of religious stimuli contributes to their experience.']
Psychology_tweet_82_p.displayed_text: Finding: Activation of the medial prefrontal cortex in all three tasks may suggest a role in representation of affective meaning for the religious stimuli and suggests that cognitive attribution and judgment of the meaning or value of religious stimuli contributes to their experience.
